title: Download Strava (free) for Android, APK, iOS and Web App
description: Track and share your workouts with Strava—a friendly, all-in-one app designed to help you stay motivated, map routes and discover new ones, get statistics, and connect with an active community.
content:
Strava is the type of application that makes your outside experience more cooperative and inspiring. At first sight, it resembles a mere tracking tool in which users can track runs, rides, hikes, and other exercise activities. However, after you start using it, you notice that it is a lot more than that.

It integrates GPS tracking and a social network atmosphere, so not only can you track your routes, times, and distances, but also share them, compare them, and celebrate them with your friends and other athletes. The app is intended to suit any person regardless of their skill level, preparing for a marathon, biking across the city, or a simple weekend stroll. The neat design also enables you to trace your steps and evaluate the route you have taken.

The other thing that makes Strava unique is the way it develops a sense of community. By uploading an activity, you do not load it just to keep it yourself, as you can find out how other people are performing or encourage them with likes and comments, or challenge yourself, which would get you to go a little step further.

The app allows you to leave marks, pursue your personal best, and learn how you compare to others on the segments of the most popular routes. Such a combination of tracking and community makes Strava seem to be more than a regular fitness app. It turns into a place where your performance is rewarded, where minor successes are celebrated, and where the stepping stone may be covered in a larger-scope adventure.

One of the largest reasons to download Strava is the motivational factor. It is not about logging data only, but it is an opportunity to follow your progress over time and to get inspired by other people in the process. After you perform an activity, you may find the pace, elevation gain, and heart rate (in case you use compatible devices), and so on. The information will enable you to determine whether you are improving or not, as well as the reality in terms of your performance. And since it is all presented efficiently, there is a clear ability to see how your work accumulates in several days, weeks, or months. The app makes your training a kind of picture story, and it is more likely that to will notice a pattern and create reasonable objectives for yourself. The other motivation that makes people love Strava is the social part. You are not exercising as a solitary person, but you are a part of a bigger group. It does not matter whether you track your ride with your local cycling friends or a global challenge against other individuals; Strava adds an additional touch of fellowship to your activities. The punch line of the review provided by friends or other sports persons can be very motivating, be it a mere thumbs up or a line in the comment that encourages you. And the sources of inspiration you get by following both beginners and the pros, which is possible due to the range of athletes that Strava features, are always varied. Strava is also in the limelight due to the virtue of versatility. This gives results in various activities other than running and cycling. It is possible to record walks, hikes, swimming and exercising in a gym, as well as exercising indoors. The app provides you with advantages to track the routes you choose, compare your work in the most famous tracks, and find new places you should visit. Whether a person loves to be outdoors or wishes to develop a regular practice of moving around, Strava combines the elements of tracking, planning, and encouragement that keep things new. Once you are competing to get a personal best or simply aim to keep up with the activities, then it is one tool that will keep you occupied.

What Are the Alternatives to Strava? Gaia GPS is a powerful substitute in case one needs to pay attention to navigation and exploration. In addition to recording, it follows all kinds of sporting activities, including hiking and cycling, but really excels in providing proper, specific offline maps and route planning. Gaia GPS is a perfect choice for those who like to go backcountry and need a bit more control over the way they map and track their routes, as there are topographic maps, overlays, and even waypoints that assist in planning all the details. Komoot is built to allow one to create and enjoy a route plan: to seek out and compile new routes and paths. It gives voice navigation by turns, hence it can be of great help to cyclists, hikers, and walkers who want guidance when they’re on unfamiliar roads. The community-based tours and the specialization in providing the user with secure, picturesque, and appropriate routes, given a certain type of activity, are the strengths of Komoot. Another alternative is AllTrails, and this is aimed at exploration and enjoying the outdoors. It has a huge catalogue of trails, including reviews by users, their photographs, and rankings in terms of difficulty. It proves to be a popular application with hikers, trail runners, and nature enthusiasts in search of routes and who would like to explore the ones at least those within their abilities. The AllTrails app allows tracking activities and discovering new ones, assisting users in selecting and enjoying the best trails, depending on their purposes and tastes.
summary: Strava, a fitness application that allows users to track runs, rides, hikes, and other exercise activities, is a social network application that combines GPS tracking and a social networking atmosphere. Users can share their activities, compare them, and celebrate them with their friends and other athletes. The app is designed to suit any person regardless of their skill level. It also allows users of various activities to trace their steps and evaluate the route. Strava's unique design and community make it more than a regular fitness app, where performance is rewarded, and where minor successes are celebrated. The application is also considered versatile due to its versatility and ability to track various activities outside of running and cycling.
shortSummary: Strava integrates GPS tracking and social network integration, offering compelling, collaborative activities and a strong community atmosphere, ideal for both active and casual users.

scraped_sources.text:
The Komoot Navigation and Routing app is designed to make people feel a little better about going outdoors. It is made to suit the tastes of people who prefer to cycle, hike, run, or simply explore the less-used paths. It is a straightforward idea. You choose the destination where you want to go, then Komoot assists you in designing the optimal path for your activity. It not only provides you with the path between A and B.
It is used by considering such factors as the type of terrain, heights, and surface of the path to propose a path that fits what you want. You have a choice of cycling on an easy trail, hiking up in the mountains, or taking a walk in the countryside; it provides you with alternatives that suit you.
The maps have been well drawn and are navigable easily using voice navigation; this voice navigation does not require the driver to stare at his or her screen. People either utilize it to chart their way or find ways that have been traced by other users. It is like carrying a guide in your pocket that can guide you to explore without worrying about unexpected obstacles.
Why Should I Download Komoot?
Among the greatest reasons to download Komoot, one must also mention that Komoot supplies you with tools that help to plan outdoor adventures much easier than before. You do not need to waste hours searching for various kinds of maps, reading discussion posts, and trying to understand whether this way is good for your physical form and the kind of activity you choose. Komoot gives you that information compiled all in one.
You are free to select the type of activity you are performing, and it facilitates customizing the path to be followed accordingly. Say, when you are bicycling, it can tell you to skip steep hills in case you prefer an easy-going ride, or suggest them if you want a more challenging ride. This is also true with walking or running. It is designed to guide you to the courses of action that are appropriate to what you want and not what fits everybody.
One should also speak about the offline map option. Your route and maps can be downloaded ahead of time, which is good because, in the event you lose your connection when you are in the middle of nowhere, you do not have to make a guess. The application will continue to take you along the route that you plotted. It is no great stretch of the imagination, but it can go a long way, and this is of great importance in spotty signal zones.
The voice instructions will enable you to concentrate on your environment and not your phone all the time. You are able to watch the view, and you will still get to be informed when you should turn or what is next. Komoot assists in removing part of the guesswork in exploring new places and retains the excitement of doing so.
Is Komoot Free?
Komoot is also free to download, but you will not be able to plan routes and trace them in a specific area without spending any money. You have to buy them separately or be able to select a paid package; otherwise, they are not available in the free model, including additional regions and functions such as complete offline maps of large areas. The minimal tools do not require any payment in advance.
What Operating Systems Are Compatible with Komoot?
Komoot can be connected on both Android and iOS. It has been developed to be effective on both smartphones and tablets, and it also has a web version to plan the routes on a large screen.
It is compatible with virtually every modern device on the market, and so as long as your phone or other tablet is at least reasonably up to date, there will be no problem. It does not consume many resources—it doesn’t take up much space or slow down your device when running in the background.
What Are the Alternatives to Komoot?
Gaia GPS is among the alternatives that someone might use if they want to have detailed outdoor navigation. It allows you to plan routes and see maps just like Komoot, but it is more focused on anyone who wants to explore backcountry trails or go off the grid. In the app, you will get topographic maps, satellite images, as well as layering to appreciate features of the territory better. It is popular among hikers, hunters, and all those traveling to the locations where the usual navigation applications do not work. Gaia GPS even has a trip recording tool and waypoint marking tool, which come in handy when one wants to attach a record to their trip, or when they just want to share the trip with someone.
Another alternative is Strava, which takes a different approach to outdoor activities. It pays more attention to monitoring and the distribution of performance. You track your rides, runs, or walks, and Strava provides you with the stats about the speed, distance, elevation, and so on. It is also targeted at individuals who prefer filling themselves with challenges or comparing their activity with that of others. There is also a heavy social aspect to the app, allowing you to follow your friends, join challenges, and check out leaderboards. It does not show much route planning. The key feature it has is making users track their fitness level and remain accountable by comparing their current performance to past ones or with those used by other users.
Another option is AllTrails, which is characterized by a large collection of user-made trail maps and reviews. Hikers love it especially because it provides all the information regarding the toughness of the trail, length of the trail, and pleasant things to look at, such as viewing points and waterfalls. The name AllTrails is so unique because of the combination of mapping and some sort of guidebook experience. It is possible to read what someone experienced on a trail, view pictures, good and bad, and obtain advice on what to keep an eye out for or where to park. It makes it easier to eliminate the guesswork when seeking a suitable hike, particularly in a location where they have never been before. It is possible to download maps to be used offline using the app, and the base of trails is constantly updated by users sharing their experience.

Gaia GPS is one of the best solutions if you're looking for reliable navigation for outdoor exploration, hikes, or off-road activities. It offers various topographic data, offline access, and planning, and it deletes routes that can be customized and used even in places without any network. You can use Gaia GPS to mark waypoints, track your route, analyze the terrain of your activity, and access multiple maps and topographic, satellite, terrain, and weather overlays.
You can download Gaia GPS and various location maps for national parks, backcountry trails, or custom areas and then follow your route offline in real-time, even with no cellphone reception. The app allows marking campsites, viewpoints, or water sources as different waypoints so that any outdoor enthusiast will benefit from this service.
Available both in free and paid versions, Gaia GPS also has a built-in compass, and you can use its features to calculate elevation profiles. You can download Gaia GPS on iOS and Android devices or access the web service through a browser. The app is extremely useful for hikers, hunters, search and rescue teams, and anyone who needs to navigate more off-the-grid areas safely.
Why should I download Gaia GPS?
Gaia GPS is a navigation system for outdoor professionals and enthusiasts, as it provides highly detailed topographic maps with various layers that you can download for offline use. The selection of maps includes USGS topo maps, satellite imagery, National Geographic Trails, Gaia Topo (vector maps with better performance), and public/private land overlays, which all work even if you don't have any cell service.
The app's features, such as real-time GPS positioning and track recording, can be used without network access. It allows you to record your paths, view distances and elevation gain, and review trip statistics, making Gaia GPS the perfect option for hikers, skiers, and cyclists. You can layer your tracks with overlays that show weather, slope angle, or terrain type and color-code your paths, as well as easily trace back your steps.
One of the most essential features of Gaia GPS is the route planner, which brings a lot of customization options so that you can draw your own paths or snap them to trails, estimate elevation profiles, and determine difficulty levels. You can save the same route in multiple versions, compare them between seasons, and share them with others. It's perfect whether you'd like to manually draw out every point or use the app's automatic features to save time. When planning your routes, you can stack different layers together, like trail maps, public and private zone boundaries, weather forecasts, and satellite images, so that you are better prepared and more informed when creating your custom path.
With Gaia GPS, you can mark and label waypoints, include notes, apply custom icons, and add photos, so when you go back to them, you can easily recognize water sources, trail junctions, campsites, or viewpoints. If you have multiple devices under the same account, all your waypoints will be synced so that you can access them both in the desktop version and mobile apps.
You can integrate Gaia GPS with various other services by importing GPX, KML, or GeoJSON files that can be used to navigate your trail. You can also export information from Gaia and upload it to services like Garmin Basecamp or Google Earth. You can collaborate with other people and share your trails with friends and family, which is especially useful for group activities. You can download Gaia GPS on iOS and Android devices and use its web service. The platform has a freemium option and various subscription tiers.
Is Gaia GPS free?
You can download Gaia GPS and use it for free, but the features it offers are limited to accessing basic maps, recording activities, and creating custom routes.
Gaia GPS also has two paid subscription plans that unlock all the app's features and maps, offline use, data, and weather overlays. One of the tiers offers an integration with the Outside network, which gives you access to Outside Learn, TV, and other services.
What operating systems are compatible with Gaia GPS?
You can use Gaia GPS on any modern web browser through its online service, but the real power of this solution lies in its mobile apps, which you can have handy when you need them.
You can download Gaia GPS on iOS 15 and higher or Android 8.0 or up and enjoy safe outdoor activities with or without cell reception.
What are the alternatives to Gaia GPS?
Maps.me is a free map service that is based on data provided by OpenStreetMap and offers global coverage. You can use it when walking, driving, or cycling with turn-by-turn navigation, and also download maps for offline use. It's not as specialized for outdoor hiking. Maps.me includes travel guides, and you can bookmark favorite locations; the app is available without any cost on iOS and Android devices, and you don't need an account to use it.
Also based on OpenStreetMap, Organic Maps is a free solution focused on privacy that comes from an open-source project and doesn't include any ads or tracking of your data. You can use it offline or online when driving, cycling, or walking, and the app has a minimalistic design and only shows you the most crucial information on the map. You can download Organic Maps on iOS and Android devices.
OpenStreetMap (OSM) is a collaborative mapping service that is used by multiple other apps as the source of maps and other data. It allows users to edit maps, export them to various formats, and import them into other apps. It serves as the backbone of multiple navigation services and apps, whether you're looking for a desktop solution or one for mobile devices.

argos_summary: Strava is a multifaceted fitness app that combines GPS tracking with a social networking aspect, allowing users to track and share their exercise activities while fostering a sense of community among athletes. It motivates users by enabling them to compare their performance with others, celebrate achievements, and set personal goals. Alternatives to Strava include Gaia GPS, which focuses on navigation and detailed outdoor exploration, and Komoot, which specializes in route planning and voice navigation for various outdoor activities.
